item.title: Isle Design
Why Build a Computer?
item.description: Isle is a computer… (common intro). Why I’m building a computer and why you might want to join me. I love islands. A small island is a world within a world; it fits in the mind yet feels liberating and alive with possibilities. Most of us can’t or don’t want to live on a small island. However, a small island can provide a temporary refuge from the wider world, a place to play, experiment, and restore perspective.

item.title: Isle FPGA Computer
item.description: Be not afeard; the isle is full of noises, Sounds, and sweet airs, that give delight and hurt not. Shakespeare, The Tempest I’m building an FPGA computer called Isle. In this post, I will introduce Isle and hopefully inspire you to come on a journey with me. Isle is a simple, modern computer. Simple in that one person can understand the whole thing: hardware and software. Modern in that it learns from the best of computers past, works with modern development tools, file formats, and Unicode.
